EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1. Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies:

Messier-Bugatti USA  (formerly A-Carb, LLC) is located at One Carbon Way, Walton, Kentucky 41094.  The propane system at Messier-Bugatti USA includes a 30,000 gallon liquid propane tank, one vaporizers, piping that conveys mixture of propane gas with natural gas (5% propane to 95% natural gas), and injection of the propane/natural gas mixture into chemical vapor infiltration (CVI) furnaces.  Propane is a listed flammable substance under the Risk Management Plan regulations found at 40 CFR 68 and is subject to those regulations since it is stored in quantities in excess of 10,000 pounds.  It is necessary to observe certain safety precautions in handling propane to prevent unnecessary human exposure, to reduce the threat to the personal health of Messier-Buggati USA employees as well as to reduce the threat to nearby members of the community.  It is Messier-Bugatti USA's policy to adhere to all applicable federal and state rules and regulations.  Safety depends upon the manner in which propane is handled combined with the safety devices inherent in the design of this facility, the safe handling procedures used, and the training of our personnel.



The emergency response program at this facility is based upon the NPGA's LP-Gas Safety Handbook, "Guidelines for Developing Plant Emergency Procedures" and "How to Control LP-Gas Leaks and Fires."  The emergency response plan includes procedures for notification of Boone County Kentucky Emergency Management and notification of any potentially affected neighbors.



2. Description of the stationary source and regulated substances handled.

Messier-Bugatti USA manufactures aircraft brake components using CVI for depositing graphite on prepared carbon fiber substrate.  Propane gas is a reactant in the process.  Brake blanks are carbonized in furnaces equipped with a thermal oxidizer and a mixture of propane and natural gas is circulated to de

posit carbon on the substance.  The remaining gas and off-gases are routed to a boiler and used as supplemental fuel.



The propane system at Messier-Bugatti USA includes the following equipment:



?    Truck Transport Unloading Station

?    One 30,000 gallon Propane Storage Tank

?    Two Propane Pumps

?    One Propane Vaporizer

?    One Control Panel at the Propane Storage Area

?    Piping, Control Valves, Safety Valves, and Instruments

?    LEL Detectors

?    Gas Chromatograph





The only regulated substance under section 112(r) handled at this facility is propane. 



The maximum amount of propane that can be stored at this plant is 101,640 pounds. 



3. Worst-case release scenario and alternative release scenarios

Worst-Case Scenario. ? The worse case release scenario required for flammable substances shall assume ?that the quantity of the substance?vaporizes resulting in a vapor cloud explosion.  A yield factor of ten percent of the available energy released in the explosion shall be used to determine the distance to the explosion endpoint if the model used is based on TNT-equivalent methods? (40 CFR 68.25(f)).  The endpoint for propane used in Messier-Bugatti USA's worst-case scenario will be a 1 pound per square inch (psi) overpressure.  An overpressure of 1 psi may cause partial demolition of houses, which can result in serious injuries to people, and shattering of glass windows, which may cause skin laceration from flying glass.



The worst-case scenario of vapor cloud explosion is based on the assumption that only one tank is affected.  The largest capacity of a single tank will be used for the scenario, 30,000 gallons.  Failure of the storage tank would release 101,640 pounds of propane.  It is assumed that the entire contents are released as vapor which finds an ignition source, and 10% of the released quantity is assumed to participate in the resulting explosion. 



The distance to the endpoint of 1 psi for the worst-case scenario is 0.4 miles. 



This distance

is used to determine the related offsite impacts on businesses and the public.  No residences were identified in the radius.  The following facilities are within the 0.4 mile radius:



?    Willamette Industries Warehouse (West)

?    Durobag Mfg. Co. (Southwest)

?    Kustom Group (West)



The remaining area within the radius is primarily farmland.



Alternative Scenario. ?  Messier-Bugatti USA considered two alternative release scenarios for the propane storage area.  Each of these scenarios will assume a vapor cloud explosion and an overspray of 1 psi.



Alternative Scenario #1:



The first alternative release scenario is a valve failure release resulting in a ? inch stream of propane escaping from one of the pipes located in the propane storage area.  Due to process alarms and regular observation of the propane storage area by Messier-Bugatti USA personnel, the release is assumed to last no longer than 60 minutes.  The resulting unconfined vapor travels to the lower flammability limit.  The release leads to a vapor cloud explosion (endpoint 1 psi).  The distance to the endpoint for the lower flammability limit for the alternative scenario is 0.2 miles.



This distance is used to determine the related offsite impacts on business and the public.  No residences were identified in the radius.  The following facility is within the 0.2 mile radius:



?    Durobag Mfg. Co. (Southwest)

?    Kustom Group (West)



Alternative Scenario #2:



If a driver fails to remove the hoses between the storage tank and the transfer vehicle before moving the vehicle, a pull-away may occur.  This pull-away will most likely cause the hose to rupture.  It will be assumed in this case that the transfer vehicle will be using an unloading house 4 inches in diameter and 25 feet long.  In addition, it will be assumed that the active mitigation devices will operate as designed, which will limit the release to the propane held in the hose.  The resulting unconfined vapor travels to the lower flammab

ility limit.  The release leads to a vapor cloud explosion (endpoint 1 psi).  The distance to the endpoint for the lower flammability limit for the alternative scenario is 0.03 miles.



This distance is used to determine the related offsite impacts on business and the public.  There are no residences or off-site facilities identified within this radius.  



4. General accidental release prevention program and the specific prevention steps. 



Messier-Bugatti USA is subject to Process Safety Management (PSM) requirements under 29 CFR 1910.119.  Messier-Bugatti USA has established a program for process safety management of the propane system, including pre-start-up safety reviews, process hazard analyses, contractor safety, operating procedures, incident reporting, training, mechanical integrity and management of change.  Equipment was installed by a certified contractor and was designed/built to National LP Gas Code NFPA 58, ASME and NEC 70 standards.  Liquid propane lines, gas propane lines, the propane storage tank and the vaporizer unit are equipped with safety relief devices.  Process safety information is maintained at the site.  



The environmental, health and safety policy at Messier-Bugatti USA is to purchase, manufacture, ship and dispose of its materials in a manner to protect the environment and the health and safety of its employees, customers and the public.  Messier-Bugatti USA has established a program for the prevention of accidents and improvements to health and the environment as described in the facility's heath & safety plan, environmental compliance manual and emergency response plan.  Messier-Bugatti USA has coordinated with Boone County Kentucky Emergency Management for emergency preparedness and response.  



Based on the amount of propane in storage, Messier-Bugatti USA is also required to comply with the Clean Air Act's Section 112(r) chemical accident prevention and response requirements.  The applicable regulations are promulgated in

Title 40 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) 68 requiring preparation and implementation of a Risk Management Plan (RMP).  The regulations have also been adopted by the Commonwealth of Kentucky by reference under Title 401 Chapter 68 of the Kentucky Administrative Regulations (KAR).  



The facility has never experienced a reportable release of propane and has had no need to use the emergency procedures.  Actions taken under the RMP prevention program and implementation of the PSM program are likely to further minimize the potential for a contingency requiring a response.



5. Five-year accident history. 



In the process of handling propane at this facility, there have not been any accidental releases of propane that led to deaths or injuries of people on site or offsite or response or restoration activities at environmental receptors in the last five years.  None of the employees or contractors have been involved in any accidents related to the hazardous substance defined in section 112(r) that was stored or handled at this facility.



6. Emergency response.



Messier-Bugatti USA personnel are trained to respond to accidental releases of regulated substances.  In the event of a release at the facility, Boone County Kentucky Emergency Management would be notified immediately.
